Text: To You, O LORD, I lift up my soul.
Context: A psalm of David expressing trust in God and a request for guidance and forgiveness.

Text: In You, my God, I trust; let me not be put to shame, nor let my enemies triumph over me.
Context: Expressing trust in God, a plea to be saved from shame and the joy of victory over enemies.

Text: Indeed, none who wait for You will be put to shame; those who act treacherously without cause will be ashamed.
Context: Affirmation that those who trust in God will not be disgraced, while the treacherous will be.

Text: Show me Your ways, O LORD; teach me Your paths.
Context: A prayer asking for God's guidance and instruction.

Text: Guide me in Your truth and teach me, for You are the God of my salvation; all day long I wait for You.
Context: Expressing dependence on God's guidance and instruction, with an acknowledgement of God as savior.

Text: Remember, O LORD, Your compassion and loving devotion, for they are from of old.
Context: Reminding God of His eternal compassion and mercy.

Text: Do not remember the sins of my youth or my rebellious acts; according to Your loving devotion remember me, for You are good, O LORD.
Context: A plea for mercy regarding past sins; a request to be remembered according to God's goodness.

Text: Good and upright is the LORD; therefore He instructs sinners in His ways.
Context: Acknowledging God's goodness and fairness, and His guidance even for sinners.

Text: He guides the humble in justice and teaches the humble His way.
Context: Describing how God leads the humble in a just path and imparts wisdom.

Text: All the LORD's paths are loving devotion and truth to those who keep His covenant and His testimonies.
Context: Emphasizing that God's ways are defined by steadfast love and faithfulness for those who follow His commands.

Text: For the sake of Your name, O LORD, forgive my iniquity, for it is great.
Context: Asking for forgiveness based on God’s own reputation and the greatness of the psalmist's sin.

Text: Who, then, is the man who fears the LORD? He will instruct him in the way he should choose.
Context: Reflection on the benefits for one who reveres God, implying guidance in life's decisions.

Text: He will dwell in prosperity, and his descendants will inherit the land.
Context: Assuring that those who fear the LORD will live well, and their offspring will benefit.

Text: The LORD confides in those who fear Him; He makes His covenant known to them.
Context: Speaking of a close relationship between God and those who hold Him in awe, including revealing His covenant.

Text: My eyes are always on the LORD, for He will free my feet from the snare.
Context: Expressing constant focus on the LORD, with an expectation of being saved from traps.

Text: Turn to me and be gracious to me, for I am lonely and afflicted.
Context: A personal request for God’s attention and mercy in times of loneliness and distress.

Text: Relieve the troubles of my heart, and bring me out of my distress.
Context: Pleading with God to ease emotional pain and rescue from difficult circumstances.

Text: Look upon my affliction and my distress, and take away all my sins.
Context: Asking God to acknowledge personal suffering and to forgive sins.

Text: Consider my enemies, for they are numerous, and they hate me with vicious hatred.
Context: Observing the large number of enemies and the intensity of their hatred.

Text: Guard my soul and deliver me; let me not be put to shame, for I take refuge in You.
Context: Pleading for protection and salvation, underscoring trust in God as a refuge.

Text: May integrity and uprightness protect me, because I wait for You.
Context: Expressing hope that a life of integrity and uprightness will provide protection while waiting on God.

Text: Redeem Israel, O God, out of all their troubles.
Context: Asking God to save Israel from its troubles, extending the personal pleas to the community/nation.
